1.text: Indeed it is not profitable to me to boast. For I will come to visions and Revelation of the Lord.

2.text: I knew a man in Christ before fourteen years, (whether in the body, I know not; whether out of the body, I know not: God knows;) such a one having been carried off even to the third heaven.

3.text: And I knew such a man, (whether in the body, whether out of the body, I know not: God knows;)

4.text: That he was carried off into paradise, and heard words not to be told, which it was not permitted man to speak.

5.text: Of such a one will I boast: and of myself I will not boast, except in my weakness.

6.text: For if I be willing to boast, I shall not be mad; for the truth will I say: and I spare, lest any reckon for me above what he sees me, or what he hears of me.

7.text: And lest I be lifted up by the eminence of Revelation, a thorn in the flesh was given me, a messenger of Satan, that he might cuff me, lest I be lifted up.

8.text: For this thrice besought I the Lord, that it remove away from me.

9.text: And he said to me, My grace suffices thee: for my power is perfected in weakness. Therefore very willingly will I boast rather in my weaknesses, that Christâ€™s power may lodge upon me.

10.text: Therefore am I contented in weaknesses, in reproaches, in necessities in expulsions, in extremities for Christ: for when I am weak, then am I strong.

11.text: I have been mad boasting; ye forced me: for I ought to have been recommended by you: for I was not greatly inferior to the sent, if also I am nothing.

12.text: Surely the signs of one sent was wrought in you in all patience, in signs, and wonders, and powers.

13.text: For what is it which ye were inferior to the rest of the churches, except that I myself acted not with negligence to you? favor me for this injustice.

14.text: Behold, I have prepared to come to you the third time; and I will not act with negligence to you: for I seek not your things, but you: for children ought not to treasure up for parents, but parents for children.

15.text: And I very willingly will expend and be expended for your souls; if also loving you more abundantly, the less I should be loved.

16.text: And let it be, I overloaded you not: but being dexterous, I took you by contrivance.

17.text: Not any of whom I have sent to you have I by him taken advantage of you.

18.text: I called for Titus, and sent with a brother. Has Titus taken advantage of you? walked we not in the same spirit? not in the same steps?

19.text: Again, think ye that we excuse ourselves to you? before God in Christ we speak: and all things, beloved, for your building up.

20.text: For I am afraid, lest somehow, having come, I find you not such; as I will, and I find you such as ye wish not: lest somehow, strifes, jealousies, wraths, intrigues, calumnies, whisperings, inflations, derangements:

21.text: Lest, coming again, my God should humble me with you, and I shall mourn for many of them having sinned before, and not having repented for uncleanness, and fornication, and licentiousness which they committed.
